gov.usgs.anss.edgemom

Class RRPServerGapFiller

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • gov.usgs.anss.edgemom.RRPServerGapFiller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public final class RRPServerGapFiller
extends java.lang.Thread
    RRPGapFiller.java this class examines files in a given directory stub for files of the form $TAG.gapN where TAG is a TAG on an RRPServerSocket configuration line and N is the number of the gap file. If it finds such files, it checks the RRPServerSocket for whether it is currently filling a gap, and if not, sets up a new gap filling range. This file also periodically checks all running gap fills and updates the gap file with new starting sequences as things proceed. When the gap is filled, the gap file is deleted. Created on Feb 18, 2015

      • RRPServerGapFiller

        public RRPServerGapFiller(java.lang.String argline,
                          java.lang.String tg,
                          EdgeThread parent)
        creates an new instance of LISSCLient - which will try to stay connected to the host/port source of data. This one gets its arguments from a command line
        Parameters:
        argline - The argument line to cause the filling (an ISILink command line)
        tg - The logging tag
        parent - The edgethread to use for logging
